description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity and sustainability of civil and criminal justice sector actors and institutions, enhance coordination amongst them, develop citizen demand for an effective and accountable justice system, and develop associations to advocate for all citizens. Justice sector actors and institutions include: police, border security, prosecutors, forensics experts, judges, court personnel, public defenders, corrections personnel, private bar, law schools, legal professional associations, and training institutions for each of them. Work towards an equitable justice system by ensuring equality before the law, fair trial standards, and other elements of procedural fairness. Ensure more equitable access to justice through innovations within and beyond the state system and through improvements in the quality and quantity of justice services, with a particular focus on women, youth, the poor, and other marginalized or vulnerable groups. Programs primarily focused on trafficking in persons or migrant smuggling should be included in element 5.3 under the Transnational Crime area in the Peace and Security Objective.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: Promote governance institutions, processes, and policies that are transparent and accountable across all development sectors. Support non-governmental as well as governmental institutions (including enforcement and investigation entities, independent audit agencies, anti-corruption commissions, procurement agencies, legislatures, line ministries, independent agencies, political parties, judicial actors, as well as civil society organizations, academia, press and the private sector). Support civic education and advocacy for reform of laws and practices or directly improving accountability and transparency of governance processes covering various development sectors.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: DDR programs generally constitute integral components of war-to-peace transitions in post-conflict environments. DDR activities are designed to reduce or eliminate belligerent armed forces and the supply of armed weapons. In particular, USG interventions seek to facilitate the return of ex-combatants, including women and children associated with armed forces, to sustainable civilian livelihoods and ease their transition to civilian communities to secure sustainable peace.

description.narrative: Assist special populations which may be vulnerable or at-risk on a temporary or chronic basis whose needs are not addressed under emergency humanitarian assistance or other programs. These include groups such as the disabled; orphans, children and at-risk youth; victims of trafficking; victims of gender-based violence; refugees, returnees, ethnic minorities, internally displaced or other socially excluded groups; the elderly; and female heads of household. Depending on circumstances, services may intend to protect groups; mitigate adverse conditions they face, or to remove barriers to help integrate them into society. Components may include measures to increase the capacity of local service and advocacy NGOs and/or professional social workers; to establish public/private service delivery partnerships as well as family and community focused service models; to establish effective referral networks; to develop appropriate service protocols and methods for screening prospective recipients; or to improve public understanding and sensitivity to the needs of the vulnerable. While services provided should not exclude victims of trafficking in persons, programs designed specifically for this group fall under the Peace and Security Objective under the Transnational Crime Area and the Trafficking in Persons and Migrant Smuggling Element.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

Objectives for Bosnia and Herzegovina: USAID's Workforce and Higher Access to Markets (WHAM) Activity stimulates job creation by advancing Bosnia and Herzegovina's trade integration with and expansion into EU and regional markets. The main goals for this project are: Improve the workforce, Increase market access, Improve product quality and use of new technology. This activity aims to increase exports by 30 percent for assisted SMEs and create 1,545 new jobs, half of which will be held by youth and 20 percent by women.

description.narrative: Reduce the threat or impact of violent conflict and promote the peaceful resolution of differences, mitigate violence if it has already broken out, or establish a framework for peace and reconciliation. This is done by identifying the causes of conflict and state failure; supporting early responses that address the causes and consequences of instability and conflict; and developing long lasting solutions to the problems that drive conflict. This includes support for processes and mechanisms for reconciliation and conflict mitigation no matter what the source of the conflict may be, though this may require integration with other elements.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

title.narrative: USAID Via Dinarica: Rural Income and Sustainable Enterprises

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): (U) USAID will boost rural incomes and improve self-reliance through the Via Dinarica Rural Income and Sustainable Enterprises project, which is implemented in partnership with the UN Development Program. (U) The project helps stimulate small businesses situated along the Via Dinarica trails to earn more income through tourism, giving people who live in these rural communities a reason and means to stay in BiH, instead of emigrating to the EU for work. (U) USAID assistance will map and promote BiH hiking trails along the Dinaric mountain range. USAID will identify and map value chains along the trails, featuring cultural, traditional, natural, and gastronomic products, and help develop these products through technical assistance and small grants so they become integrated into tourism packages. The main areas of support may include technology development, human resources, and market linkages. USAID will also leverage funding from entity and local authorities and the private sector to ensure adequate maintenance of the trails. One hundred percent of funds provided for these activities address CAATSA Goal 8.(U) Tourism is one of the fastest growing industries in BiH. Supporting this sector in rural areas will improve the economic stability and thus the self-reliance of BiH and further U.S. foreign policy objectives. Assisting BiH to enhance tourism as one of the fastest growing industries will improve the economic stability of the country, which contributes to its integration into the EU and greater regional stability, supporting the Joint Strategic Plan and the EUR Joint Regional Strategy Goal of supporting market-oriented economic reform to create growth.

description.narrative: USAID's Energy Policy Activity is helping BiH coordinate, manage, and improve transparency in the gas and electricity sectors while providing targeted technical assistance to improve and simplify the energy policy environment and legal framework. Through this project, USAID develops and/or recommends legislative and other measures at all levels of government to ensure that the BiH energy sector is compliant with EU requirements. The project also supports a strong public outreach and awareness program to promote a market-based energy sector and educate general public about the benefits of the changes taking place in the energy sector.

title.narrative: Assistance to Citizens in Fight against Corruption

description.narrative: USAIDs project, Assistance to Citizens in the Fight Against Corruption, aims to increase citizens participation in combating corruption and improve the credibility of civil society organizations (CSOs) that share a common vision and strong commitment to revealing and preventing corruption. This assistance will help engage citizens in fighting corruption in their everyday lives in areas where they feel corruption hurts them the most. It will also enable CSOs to work more closely with decision makers in the development and adoption of government anti-corruption policies.

description.narrative: Provide mediums (media, civil society organizations, advocacy groups/ associations) through which citizens can freely organize, advocate, and communicate with their government and with each other; strengthen a democratic political culture that values citizen and civic engagement, tolerance, and respect for human rights; empower citizens to participate in decision-making on matters affecting them; and mobilize constituencies to advocate for political reform, good governance, and strengthened democratic institutions and processes.

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): .USAID's general education project TABLA supports basic education by training teachers on how to incorporate critical thinking skills and integrate STEM (science, technology, engineering, and math) into classroom teaching. USAID also works to ensure systemic and continuous educational support to teachers according to EU standards.To that end, USAID will work with education institutions that provide pre-service or in-service teacher training for pre-primary, primary, and secondary school teachers, youth development instructors and counselors, and education administrators. USAID will support select educational institutions to establish quality teacher training and professional development in critical thinking and applied knowledge in STEM and stimulate discussion on education reform. USAID will also work to strengthen cooperation between universities and primary schools so that practicums and internships take place in the schools, rather than at universities.Assisting BiH in improving its educational system helps create a pluralistic and tolerant society and contributes to the country's Euro-Atlantic integration and greater regional stability, a U.S. foreign policy priority. This program will advance Joint Strategic Plan Goal 2.2, promoting a healthy and educated population to drive development..

title.narrative: USAID Monitoring and Evaluation Support Activity (MEASURE II)

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): (U) Since its inception, USAID's monitoring, evaluation, and learning (MEL) support project, or MEASURE II, has conducted a wide range of performance and impact evaluations, assessments, national surveys, and citizen polls. These actions provide the mission with flexible, demand-driven services - technical, analytical, advisory, educational, and MEL - to determine USAID project effectiveness and direction. .(U) The project will use FY 2022 funds to continue these actions and support the mission's Performance Management Plan and project MEL plans. .(U) This activity is the mission's essential implementing mechanism for ensuring effectiveness and accountability to U.S. taxpayers, as contained in the Joint Strategic Plan and the EUR Joint Regional Strategy. ..

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): (U) USAID's E-Governance project will build upon anti-corruption initiatives implemented under previous USAID activities, in both BiH and the region. (U) Through the E-Governance project, USAID will support initiatives to increase transparency and decrease corruption in targeted government-led processes, including interactions between public officials and potential investors, local businesses, and citizens. Assistance will focus on minimizing the discretion of public officials in decision making, discretion that often results in the abuse of authority and hinders processes with which they are entrusted, and will also enhance watchdog organizations' scrutiny of government-led processes.(U) The project will provide digitalization tools to fight corruption that occurs during government processes and will tackle interoperability issues between the different levels of government (BiH, Republika Srpska, and the Federation of BiH). It will make the delivery of government services to citizens and the private sector more transparent and efficient. The project will rigorously test newly developed software systems to ensure they can withstand cybersecurity threats posed by malign actors.(U) The E-Governance project will coordinate and complement project activities with those of its project 'Assistance to Citizens in the Fight against Corruption' that focus on public procurement processes. It will also work to leverage relevant departments from the U.S. Embassy to facilitate adoption of particular regulations and policies targeted by this project

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): (U) Through the Inspire Human Rights Activity, USAID champions human rights, equity, and inclusion by empowering citizens and government institutions to improve human rights in BiH.Through grants and technical assistance, the activity helps civil society organizations (CSOs) improve the BiH government's efforts to counter human trafficking and advance the self-reliance of underrepresented groups. .(U) In FY 2022, this activity will help at-risk women establish small businesses through a special entrepreneurship fund co-financed with 10 municipal governments. It will help local partners develop public campaigns to raise awareness of LGBTQI+ human rights issues. It will support alternatives to institutionalizing people with disabilities by strengthening the current system of services provided. And it will help relevant CSOs develop government policies for underrepresented groups and lobby for needed reforms. ..(U) This activity will strengthen the network of seven Service Centers for Families with Disabled Children to enhance their prospects for long-term financial sustainability. These centers support more than 1,100 families throughout BiH by providing parents and guardians with a respite from caretaking responsibilities, free legal information and advice, psychological support, and mobile services. . .(U) This activity will help BiH meet Euro-Atlantic integration requirements related to human rights. The activity supports EUR Joint Regional Strategy Goal 4 of upholding Western democratic principles by strengthening respect for civil society and Joint Strategic Plan Goal 1.3 of countering instability by strengthening citizen-responsive governance and democracy. .(U) This Implementing Mechanism contributes the full $200,000 to the Trafficking in Persons earmark, the full $50,000 to the Gender Based Violence earmark and $1,500,000 (of $15,200,000) to the Democracy, Human Rights and Governance earmark...

description.narrative: In Bosnia and Herzegovina (BiH), USAIDs LocalWorks Project supports local resource organizations to create and nurture more sustainable self-help mechanisms throughout the country, especially in areas where such mechanisms are not as readily available. Through this project, USAID will enable people to enrich their own communities and join current leaders in encouraging participatory and broad-based local development.

description.narrative: USAID Localworks funding helps countries such as Bosnia and Herzegovina to become self-reliant, ensuring that the investment of the American people results in long-term, sustainable development that ends the need for assistance. For USAID, self-reliance begins with locally led development, wherein local actors take the lead in defining and addressing the development challenges in their own communities through inclusive and participatory activities. In Bosnia and Herzegovina, USAIDs Localworks programs will increase trust among local actors, vigorously mobilize available local resources, and develop local capacity for sustainable growth.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: Reduce the threat or impact of violent conflict and promote the peaceful resolution of differences, mitigate violence if it has already broken out, or establish a framework for peace and reconciliation. This is done by identifying the causes of conflict and state failure; supporting early responses that address the causes and consequences of instability and conflict; and developing long lasting solutions to the problems that drive conflict. This includes support for processes and mechanisms for reconciliation and conflict mitigation no matter what the source of the conflict may be, though this may require integration with other elements.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Assistance for Europe, Eurasia and Central Asia (AEECA)

description.narrative: USAID helps the six communities in the fragile prefecture of Lobaye to build mutual understanding, trust, empathy, and social and economic ties across religious and ethnic lines. After years of violence and displacement, USAID is engaging communities to expand savings and entrepreneurial skills to manage personal financial affairs and build socioeconomic networks. Together with its local partner the Diocesan Justice and Peace Commission Lobaye, USAID works with local leaders, business cooperatives, and youth to institute conflict management strategies to resolve identity-based conflicts effectively, equitably, and peacefully.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Assistance for Eastern Europe and the Baltic States
Assistance for Eastern Europe and the Baltic States
Assistance for Eastern Europe and the Baltic States

description.narrative: Assist youth and adults in acquiring knowledge and developing skills beyond basic literacy and numeracy which are part of the basic education element, attitudes, and behaviors to find legitimate jobs, establish viable self-employment ventures, and stay employed and productive in a changing economy. Create policies, programs, and systems that respond to labor market demands in the formal and informal sectors.

sector.narrative: Basic life skills for youth and adults

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Assistance for Eastern Europe and the Baltic States

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

description.narrative: Improve the way the legislature and legislative processes and procedures work to uphold democratic practices. Focus on the quality and effectiveness of legislation, including the constitution, codes, laws, and regulations applying to various development sectors. Increase the legislatures capacity to be responsive to the people it serves, enhance public participation, engage in policy-making, hold itself and the executive accountable, and oversee the implementation of government programs, budgets, and laws.

title.narrative: USAID Partnership for Innovation Activity in BiH

description.narrative: USAIDsPartnership for Innovationproject supports the creation and operation of Business Innovation Centers (BICs) in four BiH cities -- Banja Luka, Tuzla, Mostar, and Sarajevo - as sustainable service providers that will continue strengthening local ICT capacity after the end of the project. The project improves SME competitiveness and productivity by increasing their use of value-added ICT and ability to offer new products and services that respond to market demand. It also enhances entrepreneurship and employment, especially among youth, by enabling them to use ICT to identify and exploit new business opportunities.

description.narrative: Assist special populations which may be vulnerable or at-risk on a temporary or chronic basis whose needs are not addressed under emergency humanitarian assistance or other programs. These include groups such as the disabled; orphans, children and at-risk youth; victims of trafficking; victims of gender-based violence; refugees, returnees, ethnic minorities, internally displaced or other socially excluded groups; the elderly; and female heads of household. Depending on circumstances, services may intend to protect groups; mitigate adverse conditions they face, or to remove barriers to help integrate them into society. Components may include measures to increase the capacity of local service and advocacy NGOs and/or professional social workers; to establish public/private service delivery partnerships as well as family and community focused service models; to establish effective referral networks; to develop appropriate service protocols and methods for screening prospective recipients; or to improve public understanding and sensitivity to the needs of the vulnerable. While services provided should not exclude victims of trafficking in persons, programs designed specifically for this group fall under the Peace and Security Objective under the Transnational Crime Area and the Trafficking in Persons and Migrant Smuggling Element.

title.narrative: USAID Strenghtening Governing Institutions, Systems and Processes In BiH

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): USAID's Strengthening Governing Institutions and Processes (SGIP) activity supports BiH's efforts toward Euro-Atlantic integration by strengthening the capacity of governing institutions to adopt, implement, and account for more effective laws and budgets. In FY 2017, the final year of the program, SGIP will complete its technical assistance by training 1,000 staff in the state, Federation of BiH and cantonal government institutions to utilize the newly adopted anticorruption checklist that must accompany new legislation. It will finalize drafting new Public Private Partnership (PPP) legislation in two cantons, to facilitate investments to improve health, heating, and other services, and will train 100 staff to implement the PPP law. The project will complete training of 150 trainers on mandatory Fiscal Impact Analysis in the Federation and 10 cantonal governments to ensure the cost estimates for implementing new legislation are reliable to avoid budget deficits.

Assistance for Europe, Eurasia and Central Asia (AEECA)

description.narrative: Support and strengthen the negotiation process and implement peace and reconciliation processes, accords and ceasefire agreements at track levels 1, 2 and 3, including support to indigenous peacebuilding efforts. For a peace/negotiations process to have a chance of success, it must entail building trust in the process, between parties, and among their constituents, with a special focus on including women. Illustrative activities include negotiation training; platform development; public opinion polling; facilitation activities; elder statesmen engagement; provision of international expert advice and knowledge; financial support to parties; multi-stakeholder dialogues; assistance with the design of peacebuilding training programs; support and maintenance of agreed verification mechanisms; support to complaint tracking mechanisms; and work with local and national government representatives to bring them closer to their constituencies.

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): USAID's Civil Society Sustainability Project will continue to support the development of civil society organizations (CSO) in FY 2018, the final year of this program.Through select advocacy sectors, the project will continue to build CSO influence on public policies by monitoring government performance, conducting policy research, and reaching out to citizens. Project partner Transparency International will continue advocating for legislative changes to improve implementation of conflict of interest laws. LEDnet, a partner representing over 13,000 businesses,will continue its campaign to decrease para-fiscal fees. WomenNet, with 300 members, will continue its public campaign to amend the Federation of BiH and Brcko District criminal codes to increase penalties for domestic and sexual violence. Partners will also advocate for business reforms that stimulate youth employment.

description.narrative: USAIDs project,Trust-Understanding-Responsibility for the Future, provides opportunities for leaders and citizens of BiH to challenge and transform their own beliefs about one another, and then start transforming their communities. The activity is based on the premise that if people adopt new, positive attitudes and thus change their behavior toward each other, then they will gradually begin to trust each others intentions and engage and collaborate on issues of common concern. Through ongoing engagement, a sense of social trust will emerge. In the resulting atmosphere of solidarity and consensus, citizens will turn their attention to their common needs and, thus, their political leaders, and hold them accountable for fostering political, economic and social stability in their communities.

title.narrative: USAID Enhancing and Advancing Basic Learning and Education In Bosnia-Herzegovina (ENABLE)

description.narrative: Our program,Enhancing and Advancing Basic Learning and Education (ENABLE), develops key science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) educational competencies in BiH. Strengthening key STEM competencies among students and their teachers is central to improving the system as a whole. The ENABLE program will improve teacher training, the development hypothesis being that if teachers are better trained, particularly in STEM-based curricula, then their teaching will improve - the ultimate result being that student learning outcomes are increased. A solid educational system will foster a knowledge-based economy and ultimately advance economic growth.

title.narrative: USAID Restoring Accountability and Supporting Transformation (RAST)

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): USAID will assist 11 municipalities/cities with improving their economic governance systems so they can obtain the internationally recognized Business Friendly Certificate (BFC), which will stimulate local economic development. USAID will analyze the internal capacity of the municipal BFC teams to identify and provide targeted technical support. The assistance priorities will be determined according to the deadlines given to the municipalities in the BFC calendar, the importance of the specific BFC criteria, and the capacity of local administration.

Economic Support Fund

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): .(U) USAID's Independent Media Empowerment Program strengthens the sustainability and self-reliance of targeted independent media outlets, improves the quality of media content, and engages citizens as active contributors to the media space. USAID will conduct the third round of its Media Production and Media Mixer small grants to support production of high-quality content and programs implemented jointly by media and civil society organizations. USAID will also fund the best ideas presented by young journalists, bloggers, vloggers, and citizen journalists through its New Voices and Ad Hoc grants. (U) USAID will help 18 media outlets develop marketing and communication strategies. It will complete the Media Outlet Capacity Assessment (MOCA) for media sub-grantees, and provide training for staff at 26 media outlets based on topics determined by MOCA. USAID will also help sub-grantees meet professional standards in financial reporting. (U) To include more citizens in the media space, USAID will provide six one-day workshops for citizen journalists and students in 10 high schools and universities. USAID will support the production of multimedia educational videos, 16 short (15-minute) videos, and six brief video messages as a tool for attracting citizen journalists. USAID will organize a video production summer school and hold 20 performances of its play, Road Show, which provokes critical thinking among citizens.(U) Through a legal defense fund, USAID will provide legal assistance for at least 10 new defamation lawsuits, and it will organize training for editors and journalists on legal protection

Objectives for Bosnia and Herzegovina: Through this project, USAID seeks to achieve the following specific results: The number of investigative or high-quality news stories produced in BiH is increased; Independent journalism products and news reach more citizens; Through the objective reporting, citizens are better informed about public policy issues, so they can hold their elected leaders accountable; Multiple, objective information sources are available; Media conduct more critical content analysis of the sector; The rights of BiH journalists are protected, and they have access to competent legal advice and representation.

description.narrative: Support and strengthen the negotiation process and implement peace and reconciliation processes, accords and ceasefire agreements at track levels 1, 2 and 3, including support to indigenous peacebuilding efforts. For a peace/negotiations process to have a chance of success, it must entail building trust in the process, between parties, and among their constituents, with a special focus on including women. Illustrative activities include negotiation training; platform development; public opinion polling; facilitation activities; elder statesmen engagement; provision of international expert advice and knowledge; financial support to parties; multi-stakeholder dialogues; assistance with the design of peacebuilding training programs; support and maintenance of agreed verification mechanisms; support to complaint tracking mechanisms; and work with local and national government representatives to bring them closer to their constituencies.

title.narrative: USAID PRO Future (II) Trust, Understanding and Responsibility for the Future

description.narrative: USAID's PRO-Future II reconciliation program will build momentum for a peace movement and hold political leaders responsible for actions that threaten peace in BiH. The program will work with community members, NGOs, mayors, and religious figures, in municipalities to lead local initiatives focused on peacebuilding and reconciliation. Core activities include: development of a citizen network that promotes peace across BiH; training on community outreach skills; reconciliation and project management; and small grants. Anti-Corruption is seen as a way to unify community groups and can be a goal of a small grant. The project will promote public engagement between religious leaders, as well as politicians, and will involve them in leading reconciliation activities and engaging influential journalists to encourage publication of alternative narratives. The program will engage regional stakeholders to play a role in securing a common regional vision.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: FARMA provides assistance to agricultural associations, cooperatives, market integrators and SMEs to improve the competitiveness of BiH agricultural producers and businesses to help them take advantage of domestic, regional, and international market opportunities. Success in these areas will build solid economic growth and reduce rural poverty. USAID and Sida collaborate on areas of overlap with the Czech government.

title.narrative: Fostering Interventions for Rapid Market Advancement (FIRMA)

description.narrative: FIRMA supports sustainable economic growth, employment expansion, and increased household incomes in BiH by helping companies better compete in international markets. The project focuses on the BiH wood processing, tourism, and metal processing sectors. FIRMA will increase sales and employment in these sectors through activities that help SMEs develop new products and improve productivity, access to markets, workforce skills, access to finance, and the business environment.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Assistance for Europe, Eurasia and Central Asia (AEECA)

description.narrative: The purpose of the GOLD is to increase the level of growth-oriented economic activity in selected localities in BiH, to set BiH on a sustainable growth trajectory, and prepare it for EU accession. GOLD will 1) promote integrated and inclusive LED planning and implementation, targeting sectors with the highest potential for rapid, sustainable job growth and promoting collaboration across municipalities, cantons, entities, and ethnic divides; 2) unlock the economic potential of municipal assets and promote new investments that support these sectors through public-private partnerships and inter-municipal cooperation; 3) engage stakeholders in the promotion of improved public service delivery and business enabling environment reforms; and 4) promote new direct investment and integrate SMEs into competitive supply chains that are linked to workforce development programs that will create new job opportunities for the BiHs youth, women and minorities.

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): USAID's Fiscal Sector Reform Activity works with the Ministry of Finance, tax authorities, and other Ministries and government institutions to improve fiscal management and coordination at all levels of government. USAID assistance will strengthen fiscal discipline and simplify business operations by introducing IT systems and automated processes for budget planning; treasury operations; risk based auditing; revenue reporting; and by introducing e-filling of taxes. It will also reduce burden of nuisance taxes on businesses/citizens. Results will include: finance statistics harmonized between entities, more efficient budget/expenditure planning systems, increased revenue collection, more efficient tax collection processes, and more efficient regulations that reduce costs for businesses and citizens. This activity supports BiH fiscal sector reforms as required by the EU Reform Agenda.

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): USAID's Energy Investment Activity provides technical assistance to the BiH government to further integrate the energy sector with regional and European markets, increase investment, and strengthen energy security. Major activities include: completion of a comprehensive regulatory framework that is consistent with Energy Community requirements and facilitates private sector engagement; establishment of independent Distribution System Operators and related rules for consumer choice and competition; and development of regulatory incentives to improve energy efficiency. The project also helps pursue public-private partnerships in the renewables sector. The program will help analyze and remove obstacles that impede investment in natural gas transmission. These efforts are essential to strengthening BiH's energy security.

title.narrative: USAID Monitoring and Evaluation Support Activity (MEASURE)

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): .USAID's MEASURE project supports the mission in monitoring and evaluating its programming in BiH. The project will continue to provide technical assistance to the mission and its implementing partners to enhance the development and tracking of indicators to more clearly identify the results of USAID programming. The project will also conduct sector and issue research and evaluations to provide the mission with data-driven analysis. USAID uses the information and tools produced by MEASURE to inform project designs and determine which aspects of programming are most effective and which do not meet mission goals. Using this data, USAID is able to capture best practices and adjust or end programming as needed. MEASURE helps meet the administration policy priority "Ensuring Effectiveness and Accountability to the U.S. Taxpayer" as contained in the Joint Strategic Plan and the EUR Joint Regional Strategy (JSP Goal 4.1 and JRS Goal 5.4). .The project will also continue building social science research and program evaluation capacity in BiH to conduct high-quality, independent evaluations and other studies. To that effect, USAID partners with The Evaluators' Institute of the Claremont Graduate University to offer a series of local training courses in social science research and monitoring and evaluation. This project supports Joint Strategic Plan Goal 4.1, strengthening the effectiveness and sustainability of our diplomacy and development investments.. .

title.narrative: USAID Fostering Agricultural Markets Activity II (FARMA II)

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): (U) USAID supports better trade integration of BiH agricultural producers through the FARMA II project, which is financed jointly with the Swedish government. USAID helps agricultural producers adopt EU and other international food standards and production techniques, produce new high-value products, and access new markets. USAID provides producers with technical assistance in adopting modern agricultural practices, capacity-building and promotional activities, and market research, and provides grants for producers to purchase essential equipment. (U) USAID assists BiH public sector partners in drafting and implementing regulations and establishing best practices in food, veterinary, and plant health and safety. It also supports BiH in the processes for accrediting and certifying the quality food and agricultural products for export. USAID assistance is targeted to subsectors with good growth potential (dairy, poultry, fruit, vegetables, honey, and medicinal and aromatic plants) and/or in rural areas where incomes can be increased

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): . .(U) USAID's Diaspora Invest project will continue to help create job opportunities for BiH citizens by catalyzing diaspora investment in BiH. USAID will expand diaspora direct investment by providing grants and technical assistance to eligible early-stage small and medium-sized enterprises and start-ups. The project will also provide diaspora investors with business services through the one-stop shop, the Diaspora Business Center, and an online diaspora business network. (U) Support will range from general investment facilitation services to technical and industry-specific support, ranging from short-term assistance (with, say, business registration or investment facilitation) to medium and long-term goals (like improving overall business performance). (U) The project will look to partner with other local communities to co-organize and support diaspora business events as part of the ongoing efforts to strengthen the Diaspora Business Center's presence throughout the country. The project will also partner with BiH, Federation of BiH, and Brcko District authorities to support implementation of two diaspora strategies previously developed and adopted with USAID's technical assistance

Objectives for Bosnia and Herzegovina: The project is expected to result in: Integration of BiH diaspora in development planning and policy implementation at all levels of government; At least 140 diaspora firms will graduate from the program, which translates into at least 250 jobs created and direct investment of $2 million through the Business Plan Competition; Increased diaspora investment by $20 million by the end of project; Increased diaspora knowledge transfer; and More cohesive diaspora business networks and continued diapora investment support through the diaspora one-stop shop and an online BiH diaspora map.

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): (U)Through its Financial Sector Reform Activity, USAID will extend and expand previously initiated work across a range of sub-activities in financial sector stability with both entity banking agencies, the BiH Deposit Insurance Agency, and the Central Bank of BiH. (U)USAID will address bank safety and soundness, bank management issues, and central banking as well as improving the auditing of public financial resources and the quality of government spending. This addresses Sarajevo Canton's need for assistance in budget planning and management (with a focus on program budgeting).(U)Public financial management needs improvement as many ministries at all levels of government operate on budgets created without much rigor or analysis. Improvements will address corruption and the bloated public sector as better-informed budget decisions and data are likely to expose patronage networks that exist in government institutions. (U)Expected results:BiH advances towards compliance with the EU accession requirements, as set out in the Reform Agenda, the EU Progress Report and the IMF program in areas of strengthening financial stability, public audit and quality of government spending; and Policies, laws and regulations from international systems are drafted for adoption and implementation in the financial, audit and quality of government spending areas.

Objectives for Bosnia and Herzegovina: USAID is helping Bosnia and Herzegovina bring financial supervision in line with EU standards. The project aims to lead to full implementation of banking laws and regulations in the Basel II/III bank supervision framework by both entity agencies according to new legislation and the IMF program.

title.narrative: USAID Anti-Corruption Civic Organization's Unified Network (ACCOUNT III)

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): USAID's Anti-Corruption Civic Organizations Unified Network helps the public to advocate to the government to implement anticorruption reforms required for EU integration. Civil society will be supported in advocating for better implementation of whistleblower protection laws; transparent and competitive processes for public procurement and public hiring; and transparency in health and education. The program will provide grants to CSOs and media outlets to conduct watch-dog activities, monitor the implementation of anti-corruption laws, produce evidence-based research, and investigative reporting. The program will produce independent, objective investigative video documentaries to expose corruption and provide evidence for prosecutions.

description.narrative: Assist special populations which may be vulnerable or at-risk on a temporary or chronic basis whose needs are not addressed under emergency humanitarian assistance or other programs. These include groups such as the disabled; orphans, children and at-risk youth; victims of trafficking; victims of gender-based violence; refugees, returnees, ethnic minorities, internally displaced or other socially excluded groups; the elderly; and female heads of household. Depending on circumstances, services may intend to protect groups; mitigate adverse conditions they face, or to remove barriers to help integrate them into society. Components may include measures to increase the capacity of local service and advocacy NGOs and/or professional social workers; to establish public/private service delivery partnerships as well as family and community focused service models; to establish effective referral networks; to develop appropriate service protocols and methods for screening prospective recipients; or to improve public understanding and sensitivity to the needs of the vulnerable. While services provided should not exclude victims of trafficking in persons, programs designed specifically for this group fall under the Peace and Security Objective under the Transnational Crime Area and the Trafficking in Persons and Migrant Smuggling Element.

description.narrative: Develop and conduct needs assessments, baseline studies, targeted evaluations, special studies or other information-gathering efforts specifically for the design, monitoring and evaluation of USG-funded programs. This sub-element may also include developing and disseminating best practices and lessons learned, testing demonstration and/or pilot models, or the preparation of strategic plans and other short-term programming tasks. Note: All such activities that are carried out by partners as an integral part of their monitoring and evaluation efforts for programs funded under other sub-elements should be included within those sub-elements.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.

description.narrative: Improve the capacity of businesses to integrate into domestic and international markets through increases in productivity and improvements in corporate governance and the development and application of modern technology and marketing practices. Enhance the capacity of businesses and business associations in terms of their corporate governance capabilities and their application of best practices and technologies to achieve increased production and marketing of products and services. It includes adoption of efficient production processes, improved labor productivity, environmentally-sound management of natural resources and the development of accounting and management systems that can help the company and industry group implement business, labor, product and process standards that enhance business competitiveness. Business capacity development programs may include activities that help men- and women-owned firms and associations respond to these international markets and create regional alliances.

description.narrative: DDR programs generally constitute integral components of war-to-peace transitions in post-conflict environments. DDR activities are designed to reduce or eliminate belligerent armed forces and the supply of armed weapons. In particular, USG interventions seek to facilitate the return of ex-combatants, including women and children associated with armed forces, to sustainable civilian livelihoods and ease their transition to civilian communities to secure sustainable peace.

title.narrative: USAID Workforce and Higher Access to Markets Activity in Bosnia-Herzegovina (WHAM)

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): (U) USAID's Workforce and Access to Higher Markets (WHAM) project accelerates job creation and advances BiH trade integration into EU and regional markets. Specifically, USAID's WHAM project will improve the capacity of high-growth and exporting or export-ready small and medium-sized enterprises in the sectors of wood processing, metal processing, apparel/textiles, and ICT sectors. The targeted sectors offer extensive EU market integration or buyer opportunities that will drive rapid growth and increase employment. USAID will continue issuing grants focused on improving the workforce, increasing market access, and raising product quality and the new product/technology development and use. (U) USAID will improve the workforce in targeted sectors by developing public and private sector partnerships to share the cost of recruiting or retraining the labor force with adequate skills. In doing so, it will bring community actors together by linking government employment and development programs with private sector expansion needs through technical schools, training centers, or other appropriate vehicles. (U) Project grants will increase market access by enabling BiH companies to attend major regional and international trade fairs. Grants will also be used to improve product quality and the use of new technology to meet the quality management and certification standards of target markets

Objectives for Bosnia and Herzegovina: Our main goals for this project are: Improve the workforce: The project will develop partnerships with public and private sector to share the cost of recruiting or retraining a labor force with adequate skills. Assistance may include providing relevant secondary schools with adequate equipment. Increase market access: The project will support companies in the targeted sectors to identify and access new customers and markets. This may include supporting private and public-sector initiatives to enable BiH companies to attend major regional and international trade fairs. Improve product quality and use of new technology: This assistance will assist companies in the targeted sectors by introducing quality management systems, technology upgrades, and necessary product/service certification required in target markets, such as EU standards and/or other relevant quality standards.

title.narrative: USAID Catalyzing Cross-Party Initiatives in BiH

description.narrative: USAID's new political process activity will assist cross-party groups to collaborate and communicate to the public on joint issue-based policies on anticorruption and issues related to Euro-Atlantic integration. The activity will also form a school to help young politicians develop their skills and knowledge to better understand the policy requirements for Euro-Atlantic integration, and to establish cross-party cooperation for developing issue-based policies.

Objectives for Bosnia and Herzegovina: USAID’s Catalyzing Cross-Party Initiatives project improves BiH’s overall reform prospects by engaging political parties in both BiH entities in cross-party discourse and policy development that focuses on pressing social and economic problems. Reinforcing cross-party and cross-ethnic groups around social and economic issues of concern to citizens will help ease ethnic tensions and facilitate reforms. The project also provides opportunities for young political actors to engage in political life more effectively, by deepening their understanding of policymaking and creating linkages between their parties.

description.narrative: (Bosnia and Herzegovina): USAID's Justice Activity will continue efforts to improve the ability of BiH justice sector institutions to fight corruption and organized crime. The project activities will continue to strengthen the position and performance of all 19 prosecutors' offices so they can prosecute cases of corruption and complex economic crime more efficiently and effectively and free them from improper external influences. The project will assist the High Judicial and Prosecutorial Council (HJPC) to begin implementing the recently adopted code of conduct, disciplinary, and appointment guidelines (developed with USAID assistance). USAID will help HJPC prepare an ethics standards handbook, as well as measures for performance appraisals of prosecutors and better appointment procedures. All activities support justice reforms as required by the EU Reform Agenda.

title.narrative: USAID Marginalized Populations Support Activity in BiH - Task Order 1

description.narrative: USAIDs Marginalized Populations Support Program supports activities of local organizations that advocate for the rights, empowerment and dignity of underrepresented groups of BiH society, and builds the capacity of local NGOs, BiH institutions and USAID implementing partners to do so. Providing underrepresented groups with opportunities to participate in civic and political issues, through their engagement in civil society organizations, will ensure that the government recognizes them as necessary and respectable partners in policy development.

Objectives for Bosnia and Herzegovina: The project aims to supports activities of local organizations that advocate for the rights, empowerment and dignity of underrepresented groups of BiH society, and builds the capacity of local NGOs, BiH institutions and USAID implementing partners to do so. Providing underrepresented groups with opportunities to participate in civic and political issues, through their engagement in civil society organizations, will ensure that the government recognizes them as necessary and respectable partners in policy development.

title.narrative: USAID Marginalized Populations Support Activity in BiH - Task Order 4

description.narrative: USAIDs Marginalized Populations Support Program supports activities of local organizations that advocate for the rights, empowerment and dignity of underrepresented groups of BiH society, and builds the capacity of local NGOs, BiH institutions and USAID implementing partners to do so. Providing underrepresented groups with opportunities to participate in civic and political issues, through their engagement in civil society organizations, will ensure that the government recognizes them as necessary and respectable partners in policy development.

Objectives for Bosnia and Herzegovina: The project aims to supports activities of local organizations that advocate for the rights, empowerment and dignity of underrepresented groups of BiH society, and builds the capacity of local NGOs, BiH institutions and USAID implementing partners to do so. Providing underrepresented groups with opportunities to participate in civic and political issues, through their engagement in civil society organizations, will ensure that the government recognizes them as necessary and respectable partners in policy development.

description.narrative: Strengthen the legal, regulatory, institutional, and information environment which protects and enables the growth in associational life and the development of independent and sustainable civil society organizations (CSOs). Build the capacity of civil society organizations to act as agents for reform and support their participation in democratic decision-making through articulating and representing their members interests, engaging in service delivery, and advocating for issues which become part of the public agenda and are reflected in public policies. Encourage the strengthening of a civic culture which supports democratic institutions and processes, active participation in political and civic life, and the civic virtues of tolerance, pluralism, compromise, trust, and respect for individual rights, including gender equality.
